item.title: 澳大利亚证券交易所重量级公司计划如何在 2025 年赚钱
item.description: 二月份的报告季即将结束，主持人丽贝卡-琼斯（Rebecca Jones）和彭博财经编辑亚当-海（Adam Haigh）将从澳大利亚最大的几家上市公司的首席执行官那里剖析全球和本地问题的重要启示。【原文：With the February reporting season almost wrapped up, host Rebecca Jones and Bloomberg finance editor Adam Haigh dissect the key takeaways on global and local issues from the CEOs of some of Australia’s biggest listed companies.】

item.title: 中国太阳能游说团在创纪录的一年后看到安装量减少
item.description: 中国太阳能产业预计 2025 年的装机量将有所下降，因为去年前所未有的新增装机量激增，导致电网竞相跟上。【原文：China’s solar industry expects installations to drop in 2025 after an unprecedented surge in additions last year left power grids racing to keep up.】

item.title: 重启世界顶级核电站面临延迟风险，日本电力公司股价下跌
item.description: 东京电力公司（Tokyo Electric Power Co.）的股价创下近五个月来的最大跌幅，此前该公司表示将推迟反应堆的升级改造，从而有可能使重启世界最大核电站的计划推迟。【原文：Tokyo Electric Power Co. slumped the most in almost five months after the utility said it would delay upgrades at reactors, risking to push back plans to restart the world’s biggest nuclear power plant.】

item.title: 豪瑟称澳大利亚央行不太可能任命持不同意见的董事会成员
item.description: 澳大利亚央行副行长安德鲁-豪瑟（Andrew Hauser）表示，澳大利亚央行不太可能在新的货币政策委员会制度下任命持不同意见的董事会成员，因为央行试图限制利率决策的 "噪音"。【原文：Australia’s central bank is unlikely to name dissenting board members under its new monetary policy committee regime as it tries to limit the amount of “noise” around interest rate decisions, according to Deputy Governor Andrew Hauser.】

item.title: 加巴德呼吁调查英国苹果公司的后门请求
item.description: 美国国家情报总监图尔西-加巴德（Tulsi Gabbard）呼吁进行调查，并对英国政府下令苹果公司为其全球客户数据建立后门表示担忧。【原文：US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard called for an investigation and expressed concern after the UK government ordered Apple Inc. to build a backdoor into the global data of its customers.】

item.title: 关税困惑支撑避险需求，黄金保持稳定
item.description: 黄金在上一交易日收盘时几无变动，在投资者权衡美国总统唐纳德-特朗普有关其计划颁布关税计划（包括对欧盟）的最新声明后，黄金保持在创纪录附近。【原文：Gold held near a record after closing little changed in the previous session, as investors weighed President Donald Trump’s latest statements about his plans to enact tariff plans, including on the European Union.】

item.description: 年期较短的亚洲新兴债券为投资者提供了一个避风港，以规避肆虐全球市场的关税风险。【原文：Emerging Asian bonds with shorter tenors are offering investors a refuge from tariff risks that are roiling global markets.】

item.title: MercadoLibre 的加尔佩林在创纪录后售出 3.3 亿美元股票

item.title: 重要审查主席称英国水务部门信任缺失
item.description: 对水务行业进行全面审查的委员会主席表示，在公司决策失误和业绩落后之后，私有化的水务行业需要重建信任。【原文：The privatized water sector needs to rebuild trust after poor decisions and lagging performance by companies, according to the chair of the commission undertaking a sweeping review of the industry.】

item.title: 印度家族办公室蓬勃发展，但也不乏失败案例
item.description: 印度的崛起以及随之而来的财富繁荣，已经造就了超过 86.8 万名百万富翁和大约 185 名亿万富翁。【原文：India’s rise — and ensuing wealth boom — has minted more than 868,000 millionaires and some 185 billionaires.】

item.title: 日本股票投资者通过新基金寻找收购目标
item.description: 一项投资于日本公司的基金将于本周五启动，预计这些公司将成为收购标的，这反映了日本公司治理改革的影响。【原文：A fund investing in Japanese companies that are expected to be in the crosshairs of takeover bids will launch on Friday in a reflection of the impact of the country’s corporate governance reforms.】

item.title: 中国困境下凯德置地利润增幅低于预期
item.description: 新加坡凯德置地投资有限公司（CapitaLand Investment Ltd.）公布的年度业绩未达预期，原因是利率环境升高和对中国的风险敞口带来的不利因素，盖过了私人基金等领域的收益。【原文：Singapore’s CapitaLand Investment Ltd. reported annual results that missed estimates amid headwinds from an elevated interest-rate environment and its exposure to China that overshadowed gains from areas like private funds.】
